snippet: As Gov. Chris Christie lays the groundwork for a Republican presidential run, the distrust that he faces from social and religious conservatives may be the biggest and least understood obstacle.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's anticipated Republican presidential run in 2016 may face biggest challenge in social and religious conservatives who remain skeptical of his ideologies; Christie, who prides himself on his defiance of political convention and who has espoused moderate Republican approach, may not fall far enough to right for such conservatives.
lead_paragraph: As Gov. Chris Christie lays the groundwork for a Republican presidential run, the distrust that he faces from social and religious conservatives may be the biggest and least understood obstacle.

headline.main: G.O.P. Right Still Has Doubt About Christie
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Right Still Has Doubt About Christie
